synopsis:
We are happy to introduce Dr. Sunanda Nair as the next dancer in the Art Heals series. She will be joining us live tomorrow (Thursday, April 16th) at 6 p.m. IST.

Dr. Sunanda Nair is the first student in India to earn a Bachelor’s and Master’s Degree in Mohini Attam in India, which she did from Nalanda Nrityakala Mahavidyalaya affiliated to the University of Mumbai, in the year 1988 and 1990. Sunanda is one of the leading Mohini Attam exponents in the country today with a valuable contribution of 33 years of performing and teaching this art form. She is a name to reckon with in the field of Indian classical dance, a highly acclaimed performer, choreographer and teacher in the international classical dance arena. Sunanda is the senior most disciple of the noted Mohini Attam exponent Padmabhushan awardee Dr. Kanak Rele to whom she completely devoted her study of the art form, and for Kathakali from Kalamandalam Krishnankutty Warier and for Bharatanatyam under Guru Shri. Deepak Mazumdar, Kalaimamani Mahalingam Pillai and Kalaimamani Kadirvelu Pillai.

In September 2016, she submitted her research thesis, “An Intrinsic Lyrical Feminism in Mohini Attam” to Mumbai University under the expert guidance of Guru Kanak Rele for which she was awarded a Ph.D. Sunanda is also the recipient of the prestigious “Kerala Sangeetha Natak Akademi Puraskar” for 2010 and “Kalarathnam” from Kerala Kalamandalam for 2016.

RECOGNITION “Laasyam” a documentary on Sunanda was one of the few films selected for the India International Film Festival in Goa; Laasyam was also featured at the Film Festival in Kolkata

A grade artiste of Central Doordarshan

Empanelled artiste of the Indian Council for Cultural Relations

At the turn of the century, 'India Today', the leading news magazine featured Sunanda as one of the 50 promising dancers of the country

A unique opportunity to perform at the prestigious Carnegie Hall, New York along with her senior students for the Festival of India.

#artheals #artforall #arthealsweek4 #samarpanaforartsandwellbeing

We are happy to introduce Deepika Varadarajan as the next musician in the Art Heals series. She will be joining us live tomorrow (Thursday, April 16th) at 12:30 p.m. IST.

Deepika is a multifaceted, versatile performer. She is a successful singer with extensive classical and light music experience. Deepika belongs to a family of music connoisseurs. Deepika's debut performance was at the age of 3 for the 64th birth anniversary celebrations of Dr. M. L. Vasanthakumari.

A disciple of Padmabhushan awardee Sudha Ragunathan for the past 20 years, Deepika also learns Hindustani Classical Music from Pandit Prasad Khaparde.

Deepika has sung in 6 languages for leading music directors like Ilayaraja, A.R.Rahman, M.S.Viswanathan, Deva and Vidyasagar. Deepika has recently sung in movies such as Middle Class Abbayi, Baahubali, CSK, Kalloori, Ayirathil Iruvar, Poyyamozhi. She has also acted in a lead role and sung in a popular tele serial “Kaialavu Manasu” and its Hindi remake “Chhoti Si Asha” directed by K. Balachander, an ace Indian director. Deepika has acted and sung in movies besides being a voice actor in movies like “The Lion King”, “Avvai Shanmugi” “Yaan”, “Sandamarutham”, “Uttama Villain”, “Thani Oruvan”, “Enakkul Oruvan” and “Thiruttu Payale 2.” Deepika is a featured All India Radio A-Grade artist. She has been conferred with titles like “Yuva Kala Bharati” by Bharat Kalachar and “Isai Chudar” by Karthik Fine Arts. However, the highest honor has been the invitation from the U.S. Department of State to participate in the Fusion Arts Exchange program at Northeastern University, Boston in the year 2008.

Deepika performs with the legendary singer Shankar Mahadevan on his special concerts. She has been a part of Star Vijay channel’s shows such as “Andrum Indrum Endrum”, “Thamizhukku Amuthendru Per”, performed music shows and hosted corporate shows of brands like ITC, Mangaldeep, Packaging Industries, Department of Commerce, Biovedas’ Medicall, Cognizant and TCS.

Deepika holds a bachelor’s degree in Engineering (Information Technology) and is an undergraduate in Sanskrit.

#artheals #artforall #arthealsweek4 #samarpanaforartsandwellbeing

We are happy to introduce Pandit Vishal Krishna as the next dancer in the Art Heals series. He will be joining us live tomorrow (Wednesday, April 15th) at 6 p.m. IST.

Born into a family steeped in Indian classical dance, melody and rhythm has always been an integral part of Pt Vishal Krishna’s life.He is a descendant of the legendary family of Acharya Sukhdev Maharaj and the 4th generation of dancers of the Banaras Gharana. His family and doyens of the Gharana include, Kathak Queen Sitara Devi, Pandit Chaube Maharaj & Nataraj Gopi Krishna.

Pt Vishal Krishna started his dance training under the strict tutelage of his grandmother Kathak Queen Sitara Devi. Training under the undisputed doyen meant strict discipline and arduous practice for several hours a day. Through the years he also learnt with his father, a respected Kathak exponent, Pt Mohan Krishan and Pt Ravi Shankar Mishra.

Pt Vishal Krishna’s compositions are based on Indian mythology, giving the dance form a spiritual essence. He has a distinctive style of dancing, drawing from the treasure trove of themes composed and choreographed by his illustrious family. A striking element is his emphasis on abhinaya, based on compositions from ancient Hindu texts. His dance is characterized by perfect sync with melody, rhythm, poetry and a face exuding the nuances of Bhavyabhakti. He merges the lyrical finesse and rhythmic prowess of kathak with intelligent use of space in his performances. The insouciance of rhythmic brilliance with virile and vigorous movements enhance the beauty of his performances making him a much sought after artiste.

Apart from being a dancer of repute, he teaches students and choreographs pieces for audiences both in India and abroad.

Pt Vishal Krishna is regarded as an artiste with immense versatility and is the torchbearer of the Benaras Gharana.

He has won accolades performing extensively in India and abroad. These include the-

Shringar Mani 
Pt Birju Maharajah Sangeet Samriddhi Samman

Bismillah KhanYuva Puraskar

#artheals #artforall #arthealsweek4 #samarpanaforartsandwellbeing

We are happy to introduce Vittal Rangan as the next musician in the Art Heals series. He will be joining us live tomorrow (Wednesday, April 15th) at 12:30 p.m. IST.

Vittal Rangan is a Chartered Accountant by profession and has cleared his C.A. Final in a single attempt. He started learning violin at age 8 initially from Late Sri. R.R. Keshavamurthy, and later from Sangeetha Kalanidhi Kum. A. Kanyakumari. He is an 'A' graded violinist and recipient  of the Shanmukhananda Bharat Ratna Dr MS Subbulakshmi Fellowship Award and the CCRT Scholarship. 
He has to his credit the following awards - 
Best Violinist – Parthasarathy Sabha, Chennai - 2015

Best Violinist Award at Kalavanta National Youth Festival - 2014

1st Prize in All India Radio National Competition – 2010

Pratibha Akanshi Award from Ramaseva Mandali April 2009

Ananya Yuva Puraskara Award 2009

Rotary Young Achievers Award– 2009

Lalgudi Gopala Iyer Best accompanying violinist–Krishna Gana Sabha 2009

1st Prize in Instrumental music competition Indian Fine Arts Madras – 2008

1st Prize in Instrumental – Music Academy Madras 2008

Best Violin support artist Ananya Cultural Academy 2008

CONCERTS:

Vittal Rangan performs with his Guru Kum. A Kanyakumari all over India. He has also accompanied great stalwarts and other senior musicians such as Padmabhushan awardee Sri. R.K. Srikantan, Padmabhushan awardee Sri. T.V. Sankaranarayanan, Sri. O.S. Thyagarajan, Sangeetha Kala Acharya Smt. Neela Ramgopal, Sri. S. Shankar, Smt. Ranjani & Smt. Gayatri, Smt. Kaushiki Chakraborty, Smt. Vishaka Hari, Sri. T.M. Krishna, Sri. N. Ravikiran, Sri. Sashank, Sri. Abhishek Raghuram, Sri. Kunnakudi Balamuralikrishna and Sri. Saketharaman.

He has toured several countries including New Zealand, Malaysia, Dubai, Germany, Brussels, Paris and Switzerland.

#artheals #arthealsweek4 #artforall #samarpanaforartsandwellbeing

We are happy to introduce Renjith Babu as one of the performers of our day long Tamil New Year celebrations as part the Art Heals series. He will be joining us live tomorrow (Tuesday, April 14th) at 6 p.m. IST.

An artist who exemplifies the best in Bharatanatyam, yoga, and martial arts; Renjith Babu combines his artistic excellence with a scientific understanding of the human body and its movements. The perfection and stylistic accessibility of his performances are extolled not just by critics and connoisseurs, but also by audiences uninitiated with the finer points of the dance form.

He started his training at the age of 5, under the tutelage of Smt. Prasanna Prakash (Kerala, India) and later he joined at the world renowned Kalakshetra (Chennai, India) where he acquired his dance diploma in the year 2000. He began his advanced training under the veteran Guru Professor C.V. Chandrasekhar and continues to do so till date. He has studied abhinaya in the ‘Navarasa Sadhana’ - Phase 1, acting methodology developed by Kathakali and Kudiyattam artist, Sri G Venu.

Renjith has been featured as the principal dancer in acclaimed dance productions of senior gurus including that of his own Guru, Professor C.V. Chandrasekhar and the Dhananjayans' to name a few. His collaborations with leading artists have also resulted in the creation of some very widely appreciated productions.

Renjith’s expertise has been enlisted by several dance schools in India, Australia and the United States, where he has conducted both Bharatanatyam and Yoga classes. His ability to teach the nuances of Bharatanatyam practice, theory and Nattuvangam makes him one of the sought after teachers in the field. An imaginative and vivid choreographer, Renjith’s creative works have received accolades the world over among the Indian dance diaspora.

#artheals #artforall #tamilnewyear2020 #samarpanaforartsandwellbeing

We are happy to introduce Nitya Narasimhan as one of the performers of our day long Tamil New Year celebrations as part the Art Heals series. She will be joining us live tomorrow (Tuesday, April 14th) at 7:30 a.m. IST.

Nitya Narasimhan is a Bharatanatyam dancer and Artistic Director of the Prayukti Academy for Indian Arts, California. She is under the tutelage of Guru Rukmini Vijayakumar, Bangalore and is a senior disciple/dancer in the Raadha Kalpa Dance Company. She began her Bharatanatyam training at the age of 4 and spent her formative years learning under Guru Suma Mani, Chennai. Nitya holds a diploma in movement and pedagogy from Attakkalari Centre for Movement Arts and Media and is currently pursuing an Art of Teaching program in Iyengar Yoga.

Nitya is a solo and freelance performer in the Bay Area, California and has worked with many reputed companies including Smt Vidhya Subramanian's Ensemble, Nava Dance Theatre, Abhinaya Dance Company and has been a part of notable productions touring across the US. She also extensively presents solo work and has been performing for the Chennai Marghazi season.

#artheals #artforall #tamilnewyear2020 #samarpanaforartsandwellbeing

We are happy to introduce Vithya Arasu as one of the performers of our day long Tamil New Year celebrations as part the Art Heals series. She will be joining us live tomorrow (Tuesday, April 14th) at 11 a.m. IST.

Vithya, a classical dancer with an experience of over 22 years in Bharatanatyam, is also a trained Odissi and a Mohiniattam dancer.

Her training in Bharatnatyam began at the age of 7 with Guru Krishnamoorthy and then continued to learn at Yoganjali Natyalayam. She has done her graduation in Performing Arts at Bharathiar Palkalaikoodam and her Master of Fine Arts from Sastra University. She has cleared the National Eligibility test in 2015. She has done a Diploma in Dance Teacher Training from Tamil University. She started learning at Nrithyodaya in 2013 under the Guru Dr. Padma Subrahmanyam, Srimati Uma Shriram and Dr. Gayatri Kannan. She has completed the Nritya Shali course which includes all the 108 Karanas and Angaharas.

Vithya started leaning Odissi from Ms. Kanchana from Auroville, a graduate from Nrityagram. She later received training from Guru. Surupa Sen at the city classes conducted in Bangalore and from Nrityagram. Her training in Mohiniattam is from Guru. Vichitra Dinakaran, a graduate of Kalamandalam and an Assistant Professor of Bharathiar Palkalaikoodam in Pondicherry.

She has performed extensively in her Guru Dr. Padma Subrahmanyam’s productions have been staged in India and abroad and has taken part in all the dance programs of the December season with her group since 2013. She has assisted her Guru Dr. Padma Subrahmanyam for a workshop conducted in Sri Lanka in 2016. She has performed for various prestigious festivals . She has demonstrated Odissi and Mohiniattam at the 38th Natya Kala Conference and at the Natyasastra Utsav organised by BIFAC, Sangeet Natak Akademi and Kalakshetra.

Vithya’s achievements include winning the Best Performer Award from Sri Parthasarathy Swamy Sabha in 2018. She is a recipient of Young Artistes Scholarship of ICCR from 2014-2016, a Gold Medalist in Bachelor of Performing Arts for the batch 2007-2011, has acquired the first mark in the Karana Exam (Nritya Shali) conducted in 2014, to name a few.

We are happy to introduce Jayakumar Baradwaj as one of the speakers of our day long Tamil New Year celebrations as part the Art Heals series.
He will be presenting a talk  on 'Temples and the Arts' and will be joining us live tomorrow (Tuesday, April 14th) at 3 p.m. IST.

S.Jayakumar is a performing classical musician trained at Kalakshetra Foundation. An avid researcher in the fields of Classical Music & Dance, South Indian History and Cultural History; he has professionally been associated with various institutions as a faculty and expert resource person for over a decade. Owing to his academic inclinations, he has presented talks and lecture demonstrations at various venues.

A firm believer that a greater understanding of our past will increase the chances of creating a better future, Jayakumar is also the founder of a Culture Travel Company Courtyard Tours and an NGO, Prastara.

Jayakumar holds a master’s degree in Music, another Master’s in History and Heritage Management and one in Tamil Literature. He additionally holds a diploma each in Sound Engineering and Saiva Siddhanta. He has been trained in Epigraphy under the tutelage of Padma Bhushan awardee Dr. R. Nagaswamy and Professor S.Ramachandran of the State Archaeological Department, Tamil Nadu. He has had the privilege of working with some of the finest performing artistes in the Indian subcontinent. Some of his notable works: Bombay Jayashri’s musical drama ‘Thyagraja’, Mani Ratnam’s current magnum opus ‘Ponniyin Selvan’ for which he is the Research Consultant.

#artheals #artforall #tamilnewyear2020 #samarpanaforartsandwellbeing

We are happy to present Amritha Murali as one of the performers of our day long Tamil New Year celebrations as part of the Art Heals series. She will be joining us live tomorrow (Monday, April 14th) at 12 p.m. IST.

Amritha Murali is one of the most talented, popular and sought after musicians of the current generation. Her exceptional musical instincts have been well nurtured by her parents and Gurus. She has, today, gained much acclaim and recognition within the music fraternity as an extremely gifted, well accomplished and sensitive musician.

Amritha’s music has been honed by Vidvan Sri K R Kedaranathan, Vidushi  Smt Meera Kedaranathan and Vidushi Smt Rama Ravi. She is currently under the tutelage of Vidvan Sri P.S.Narayanaswamy and Vidvan Shri R.K.Shriramkumar for vocal music. She is also adept at playing the violin and trains under Vidushi Smt.T.Rukmini.

Her music showcases the value of classicism that is reflective of a hoary tradition. Endowed with a perfect blend of mellifluous voice, sharp intellect and focus on the aesthetic, Amritha’s performances are marked with erudition and emotion.

She has performed for many premier institutions and centers all over India and abroad. She has many awards to her credit and her music has earned the appreciation of the cognoscenti and the lay person alike.  Amritha has to her credit

Ustad Bismillah Khan Yuva Puraskar  from the Sangeet Natak Akademi , New Delhi, “Kala Ratna ” from the Cleveland Tyagaraja Aradhana, “Yuva Kala Bharathi” from Bharat Kalachar, Chennai,

Kalki Krishnamurthy memorial award

the title of ‘Nada Oli’ from Nada Inbam, Chennai, Outstanding Vocalist award from the Music Academy,Chennai for many years, to name a few.

She has won numerous awards and prizes as a violin artiste as well. She has performed many a concert with her guru Smt.T.Rukmini and has accompanied on the violin many senior artistes all over the country and abroad.

Amritha is an A-graded artiste of the All India Radio and Doordarshan, Chennai.

She was granted a fellowship by the Sangeet Natak Academy,New Delhi to learn advanced  ragam, tanam and pallavis under Vidvan Shri B.Krishnamoorthy.

We are happy to introduce Yogi Digvasu who will be presenting a talk on ‘Holistic Lifestyle’ as part of our day long Tamil New Year celebrations as part the Art Heals series. She will be joining us live tomorrow (Tuesday, April 14th) at 1 p.m. IST.

Sri Digvasa is a holistic lifestyle coach and a teacher of classical Yoga. He faciliates

Corporate workshops on Classical Hatha Yoga, Holistic Lifestyle, Stress Management, Personal Effectiveness, Raw Vegan Diet expert

Public Workshops on Classical Hatha Yoga, Successful & Happy Living, Holistic Lifestyle  Personal one to one Coaching, Counseling 
His mission is to create a joyful, peaceful and a loving world by transforming humans life and consciousness to attain their ultimate well being.

#artheals #artforall #samarpanaforartsandwellbeing #tamilnewyear2020

We are happy to introduce Dr. Sunita Menon who will be presenting a talk on 'Social Distancing and Mental Health' for our day long Tamil New Year celebrations as part the Art Heals series. She will be joining us live tomorrow (Tuesday, April 14th) at 5 p.m. IST.

Ms Sunita Menon is a Cognitive Behavioural Therapist in Private Practice in Chennai, India for almost 10 years now. she sees clients with issues ranging from personality disorders and addictions to pre-marital and couples counselling. Besides face to face sessions, web therapy is also offered to clients from across the globe besides India.
www.sunitacounsel.com

#artheals #artforall #tamilnewyear2020 #samarpanaforartsandwellbeing

We are happy to introduce Vivek Sadasivam & Vinay Varanasi who will be presenting a session on 'Carnatic Music and Storytelling' for our day long Tamil New Year celebrations as part the Art Heals series. They will be joining us live tomorrow (Tuesday, April 14th) at 2 p.m. IST.

Their performance is an interpretation of certain rather unexplored facets of the Panchabhootalinga Kritis of Nadajyoti Muthuswamy Dikshitar through storytelling and music. Dikshitar has composed kritis in each of The Panchabhootam or 5 elements - earth, water, fire, air and sky in the respective kshetras and while it is vast topic,they hope to view it through a different lens and keep it engaging for viewers with interests in all forms of the arts.

Vinay Varanasi is an architect by profession. In the field of music, he takes up compositions, and expresses them visually through paintings. He is exploring collaborations with musicians to showcase the confluence of music and visual arts. His first endavour in this effort was a collaboration with ramakrishnan murthy titled-Kalaabhyaam. He has collaborated and curated programs with Vivek Sadasivam and Sumesh Narayanan in this regard.Vinays interest in Sahithya has also led him to co-translate the compositions of Yogi Nareyana of Kaiwara. He writes Pallavi lyrics, and these Pallavis have been tuned and sung by vidushis Ranjani and Gayatri, Ramakrishnan Murthy, and J.A Jayanth.

Vivek Sadasivam is a Carnatic musician hailing from the direct Shishya Parampara of Nadajyoti Muthuswamy Dikshitar. After initial training from his grandfather Sri. Anantharaman Iyer and grand-aunt Smt. A Champakavalli, he carried on learning from his father Sri. A. Sadasivam. He is currently under the tutelage of Vid. Rudrapatnam Thyagarajan and Vid. Sanjay Subrahmanyan. A performing musician, he has received recognitions from The Music Academy Madras, Shanmukhananda Fine Arts, Sri Rama Seva Mandali and several other music organisations. He is an empanelled artiste of the ICCR and an A  grade artiste of All India Radio and Bangalore. Vivek has performed across India and abroad and collaborated with various artistes across art forms.

We are happy to introduce Sumesh Narayanan as one of the performers of our day long Tamil New Year celebrations as part the Art Heals series. He will be joining us live on Tuesday, April 14th at 4 p.m. IST.

Sumesh has been under the tutelage of Mridangam Maestro Kalaimamani Sri Thiruvaarur Bakthavathsalam for more than 20 years and has acquired the nuances of the traditional gurukulam approach of learning.

Sumesh has been performing for more than a decade in the city's prestigious sabhas and also frequents many other cultural hubs in the country. He also has to his credit, the experiences of collaborating with a number of contemporary musicians in many world music ventures. Owing to the same, he has been featured in prestigious magazines like the Open magazine, Sruthi, Provoke Lifestyle and others on a number of occasions apart from newspaper reviews and articles.

Apart from being a classical performing artist, Sumesh has also been a part of a number of innovative outfits that cut across musical genres and styles resulting in a contemporary flavour that suits the mindset of the newer generation.

#artheals #artforall #tamilnewyear2020 #samarpanaforartsandwellbeing

We are happy to introduce Malavika Rajhesh as one of the performers of our day long Tamil New Year celebrations as part the Art Heals series. She will be joining us live tomorrow (Tuesday, April 14th) at 7 p.m. IST.

Malavika started learning classical music at the age of 4 under her grandmother Smt. Kunnakkudy Bala. She has also been learning to play the Veena from her father Kalaimamani Shri. Rajhesh Vaidhya for a couple of years now.

Malavika was a part of a renowned television Reality show  Super Singer Season 6 (Vijay TV) and bagged the 2nd runner’s up position in the same. Malavika now performs in live concerts worldwide like Canada, Durban, London, Switzerland, Australia, Singapore and the United States.

Malavika released her first devotional album in the year 2015 named “JAGATHGURU” which was composed by her father Shri.Rajhesh Vaidhya.

Malavika has performed along with many leading band acts in the industry such as Rajhesh Vaidhya Live , Stephen Devassy’s Solid Band , The Non-Violinist Project.
She recently performed with the living legend “Shri.S.P.Balasubrahmanyam” sir.

Malavika is also a part of Do You Have A Minute Series Live where songs are performed exactly for 1 minute (An Initiative by Shri. Rajhesh Vaidhya). Malavika has been felicitated at various events. She was also a part of the record attempt (Asia Book of Records), where the team accomplished 60 songs in 60 minutes as a part of Do You Have A Minute Series Live which was lead by Shri.Rajhesh Vaidhya.

#artheals #artforall #tamilnewyear #samarpanaforartsandwellbeing

We are happy to introduce Ananya Bhat as one of the performers of our day long Tamil New Year celebrations as part the Art Heals series. She will be joining us live tomorrow (Tuesday, April 14th) at 10 a.m. IST.

Ananya Bhat - daughter of renowned astrologer Vishwanath Bhat and homemaker & boutique owner Revati Puranik - is a multi-lingual playback singer, performer and actor.

Her initiation into music began when she was five. She trained in singing under Vidwan K Guruprasad and Roopa Guruprasad, R.S.Nandakumar n later by Smt.Bhargavi , now she is learning under Vid. Ananth Bhagwat.

She entered Rangabhoomi (theatre) at age 10, where she learnt to face the stage and to perform. She also realised her singer's voice, thanks to the guidance of theatre greats like Raju Anantaswamy, Mandya Ramesh and Shivaji Rao Jadav. Not too far away was her training in classical music. Along with taking up junior and senior classical exams, she learned Hindustani music under Vidwan Veerbadrayya Hiremath.

Notably, she is the winner of the 64th South Filmfare Award (for best playback singing – female) for singing 'Namma Kaayo Devane' in 'Rama Rame Re'.
She won Mahila sadhaki award -2018 from suvarna news channel for her achievement in art at a very young age.
She also grabbed her Star Singer award - 2019  from "Chitthara magazine" at their 10th year anniversary. She has collaborated with music directors from Kannada, Tamil, Telugu and Bollywood.She has sung for movie KGF which had 3 songs of her's in all 5 Languages it was released.

She has crooned many a tunes for special shows such as Yuva Dasara, Bengaluru Ganesha Utsava, Gaganachukki Bharachukki Utsava recently her performance at Isha Sadguru stole millions of people's heart along with the Sadguru Jaggi Vasudev's where he himself mentions in the video before she sings and is also found crying after her divine performance in front of adiyogi on the auspicious night of MAHASIVARATHRI. 
She turned an actor on big screen with movie Urvi, Bhoothakala , Bhramaka n many more which are yet to get released. However, her roots in theatre remain strong.

#artheals #artforall #tamilnewyear2020 #samarpanaforartsandwellbeing

We are happy to introduce Pavitra Krishna Bhat as the next dancer in the Art Heals series. He will be joining us live tomorrow (Monday, April 13th) at 6 p.m. IST.

Pavitra is one of the most distinguished disciples of the renowned Bharatanatyam exponent Guru Shri Deepak Mazumdar and had his initial training from Kalanjali under Kumari Vasantha. “Clarity and geometry marked this slim dancer’s movements, while his footwork was powerful.“ said The Hindu. Termed as an effortless dancer with precise movements Pavitra has been appreciated for his pure dance and sensitive Abhinaya by critics, connoisseurs and peers. Pavitra is an extremely vibrant and graceful performer.  It is a treat to watch him live on stage.
An ICCR Empanelled artist and ‘A Grade’ artist of Doordarshan ,  For his constant efforts , he has been awarded and recognised with Acharya Vishwanath Dev Sharma Talent search Award by Vedic Heritage, New York. 
Lakshmi Vishwanathan Award for Abhinaya by Krishna Gana Sabha ,Chennai

YUVA KALA BHARATHI

Aarsha Kala Choodamani Title conferred by Shri Dayaananda Saraswati ji in Pennsylvania (USA)

PANDIT BHIMSEN JOSHI Award

KALA RATNA AWARD – CLEVELAND –USA

SHANMUKHA SANGEETHA SHIROMANI

Toured toured Dubai, Canada, Malaysia, Indonesia and USA  for performances also toured all over India for showing his talent.

To fulfil his urge to teach and spread knowledge to local talents he began P.A.V.I. (Pavitra Art Visual Institute), A Bharatanatyam Institute established in a suburb of Mumbai.

April 14 is Tamil new year day and we at Samarpana have more reasons to rejoice. We know what we are currently going through are tough times. But please remember “this too shall pass”

We have to show our solidarity in this unprecedented fight against Corona and we shall come out of this with more positivity, more power and more compassion to other beings 🙏

To keep the spirit going, we are extremely happy to put together a series of live sessions from 7.30 am to 8 pm on April 14. Please do join us and kindly spread the word. We'd like to take this opportunity to thank all the artistes from the bottom of our hearts who have graciously accepted to perform. While we are able to enjoy the comforts of our home, let us remember the daily wage workers whose lives have come to a standstill because of COVID and contribute as much as we can for their well-being.

We request you to attend the live series and just forget everything else and immerse yourselves in one day of unlimited calming, enriching and entertaining sessions.

#artheals #artforall #fightingcovidtogether #stayhome

We are happy to present Smt. Indira Kadambi as the next dancer in the Art Heals series. She will be joining us live tomorrow (Sunday, April 12th) at 6 p.m. IST. "An artist who has won enough critical acclaim, Indira Kadambi is a connoisseur's delight, is known as dancers dancer, yet is so deeply rooted and approaches art form with a reverence that few artists are able to maintain after becoming a globally known brand themselves.." -Swapna Narayanan, Eyra.

A woman of substance for whom Bharatanatyam is a personal statement, Indira is one of the prime students of Abhinaya doyen Guru Smt. Kalanidhi Narayanan. Initially trained underGuru Sri. Janardhan Sharma, Smt.Usha Datar and Smt.Narmada, Indira has travelled all overthe world for performances and workshops inspiring hundreds of students and teachers. Ateacher par excellence, Indira is the Director of eAmbalam, the World’s first Online Collegeof Indian Performing Arts, a state of Art blended e-learning platform, where students aretrained holistically through practical, innovative and niche teaching methodology. She is thecontent creator for Life Art Education where over 20000 children are trained under a nicheK12 value based education program established by her well known musician husband VidwanT.V.Ramprasadh.

Indira has choreographed and performed several unique solo productions such as Vamshi - TheDivine Flute, Hasya -  The Humor, Varsha Rithu - The Monsoon, Purusha Parinaam - Man Through Times, to name a few. She recently created history in the field of Bharatanatyam by reviving the art of performing a Margam for 4 hours.

For her contribution to the field, Indira Kadambi has been honoured with titles 'Vidya Tapaswi' from TapasFoundation Chennai, 'Nrithya Kala Sagara' from Cleveland Thyagaraja Aradhana and 'OutstandingSenior Dancer Award' from Natyarangam, Chennai.

#artheals #artforall

We are happy to present G. Narendra as the next dancer in the Art Heals series. He will be joining us live tomorrow (Saturday, April 11th) at 6 p.m. IST.

Narendra is a post graduate from Kalakshetra Foundation and the Founder/Director of Avigna Dance Ensemble. He haschoreographed several dance productions including 'Abhyasa', 'The Living Tree’, ‘Silappadikaram’, successfully toured worldover and won critical acclaim. Narendra has collaborated in productions with several Indian and International organizations and is well known for his excellent technique. A dancer who is lauded for his stage presence, is also associated with premier Natya institutions, offering creative support for their productions.

Narendra's constant thirst to innovate drives him to explore differentiated spaces to demonstrate his art. This drives him seek
opportunities to collaborate with artists, institutions and spaces which transgress the defined boundaries in which Natya is presented. He looks forward to performing in intimate spaces and chamber concerts that provide audience an opportunity to experience art up- close and connect with the emotional journey of the presenter. With the background of his traditional learning blended with contemporary perspective, Narendra often expresses himself through writing, dialogue and conversations.

While in Kalakshetra, Narendra has performed lead roles in the ballets and productions. He has been associated with severalproductions and institutions internationally including:

Cleveland Cultural Alliance, USA as Artistic Director and Resident Teacher • Pivotal roles in productions like Jungle Book in association with Ohio Ballet

Performed at Millennium Mission Congress at St. Peter Square
‘Farce of The Drunken Monks’ for Sankalpam, a U.K based Dance Company. ‘Shingikaku’ a Japanese production for the internationally known Smithsonian Dance Festival

PA (People’s Association Singapore) to choreograph and perform Navarasa Ramayana along with SIOC(Singapore Indian Orchestra And Choir)

Khujuraho Festival, India

#artheals #artforall

We are happy to present Rangappriya Sannkaranarayanan as the next musician in the Art Heals series. She will be joining us live tomorrow (Saturday, April 11th) at 12:30 p.m. IST.

Rangappriya Sankaranarayanan is a passionate violinist who has been receiving rigorous training in Indian classical violin since the age of ten. She began her training under the guidance of Sangeetha Rathnam Sri. T. S. Rajagopala Iyer. She has also learnt from Padma Shri awardee Sangita Kalanidhi A. Kanyakumari. Since 2013, Rangappriya has been under the able tutelage of Kalaimamani Embar S. Kannan.

Rangappriya is an experienced performer on stage, having performed extensively in concerts with both her teachers A. Kanyakumari and Embar Kannan. She is proficient in all three avenues - as part of group violin concerts, as an accompanying artiste and in performing duets. Winning first place in the Carnatic solo violin competitions organised by Sabha-s like the Mylapore Fine Arts, Chennai and Rasika Ranjani Sabha, Trichy among several others are testimony to her skill and training. Rangappriya strives to be a complete musician and has also acquired knowledge on the technical front of music production, owing to the exposure given to her by her teacher Embar Kannan, whom she has accompanied to many a recording studio. She is now training in the theory of Western classical music from Trinity College, London. Apart from playing the violin, her interests include composing scores and doing voice overs.

She is currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Dental Surgery (BDS) at SRM Dental College, Ramapuram and is in her final year.

Some notable achievements of Rangappriya are:

Starting an all women ensemble ‘Pravaham’

Being placed as a semi-finalist in the reality show India’s Got Talent Season 8 (2018) where she was a golden buzzer contestant and performed on the violin along with Navneeth Sundar on the iPad

Performing for television channels Jaya TV, Sun TV, DD Podhigai and SVBC as an accompanying artiste

#artheals #artforall

We are happy to present Prateeksha Kashi as the next dancer in the Art Heals series. She will be joining us live tomorrow (Friday, April 10th) at 6 p.m. IST.

Prateeksha Kashi is being trained in Kuchipudi under the guidance of her mother and Guru Vyjayanthi Kashi, a celebrated performer and choreographer. She has performed in several prestigious dance festivals at regional, national and International levels. An empanelled artist of Indian Council for Cultural Relations (ICCR), Prateeksha has toured various countries not only to perform but also to conduct workshops along with her Guru.

Prateeksha is an A grade artist of the broadcasting media-Dooradarshan Kendra. She has been honoured with Ustad Bismillah Khan Yuva Puraskar 2013-2014 by Central Sangeet Natak Academy, Aditya Birla Kalakiran Puraskar and Medha Jalota Puraskar from Jalota Welfare Foundation. Prateeksha has the title of Nalanda Nritya Nipuna, instituted by Nalanda Dance Research Centre. She has released a Kuchipudi DVD titled The Magic of Kuchipudi featuring the choreographic works of her Guru, Vyjayanthi Kashi.

#artheals #artforall

We are happy to present Sushma Somasekharan as the next musician in the Art Heals series. She will be joining us live tomorrow (Friday, April 10th) at 12:30 p.m. IST.

Sushma Somasekharan is a Carnatic Vocalist based in Singapore and Chennai. Sushma has performed in several prestigious organisations including Madras Music Academy, wherein she has won the Outstanding Vocalist Award - Junior for her performance, Esplanade Theatres by the Bay Singapore, Indian Embassy Brussels, Indian Consulate Luxembourg, Bharatiya Vidya Bhavan London and many more. She recently toured the USA in April 2019 with Dr Gowri Ramnarayan as part of the DK Pattamal centenary celebrations. She also collaborated with in London with Mythili Prakash for her premiere of her production, Here and Now. Passionate about bringing Carnatic Music to the uninitiated, Sushma is also a lecturer at the National Institute of Education, Singapore where she hopes to inspire students to learn more about Indian Classical Music.

#artheals #artforall

We are happy to present Purvadhanashree as the next dancer in the Art Heals series. She will be joining us live tomorrow (Thursday, April 9th) at 6 p.m. IST.

Purvadhanashree is a Vilasini Natyam and Bharatanatyam artiste. From 2000 to 2014 she learnt Vilasini Natyam under Padmabhushan Guru Swapnasundari.  Sahitya Kala Parishad, Delhi selected Purva under the Young Talent Scholarship in the year 2002.

For the achievement in the field of Vilasini Natyam, Central Sangeet Natak Akademi awarded Purvadhanashree the Ustad Bismillah Khan Yuva Puraskar  in 2008. She is an empanelled artiste of SPIC MACAY and has been regularly conducting workshops and Lecture demonstrations across the country. In 2015 Bhanja Kala Mandap, Bhubaneshwar honoured Purva with the Jayadev Puraskar. And in 2016 she was awarded the Devadasi Sashimani Devi Smriti
Puraskar in the 11th Devadasi National Dance Festival, Bhubaneshwar. 
Purvadhanashree is the daughter and disciple of Guru Kamalini Dutt in Bharatanatyam. She is a "TOP grade” Bharatanatyam artiste of Doordarshan and an empanelled artiste of ICCR.

We are happy to present Vishnu Ramprasadh as the next musician in the Art Heals series. He will be joining us live tomorrow (Thursday, April 8th) at 12:30 p.m. IST.

Vishnu R is a guitarist, composer, inventor and patent-holder of NAVTAR ®️, the only instrument in the world showcasing the best of Indian microtonal and Western harmonic music. Vishnu's unique, superlative command over Indian and Western traditions has gained him international attention, with performances and workshops across India, Europe and USA. He is a Grade 8 distinction holder in Western Classical Guitar performance from the Trinity College of London.

Vishnu has been awarded the Chennai/Karnataka Rajyothsava award, Pogo Amazing Musician award in 2010 for his efforts. Vishnu has also played guitars for numerous Indian Films. He has given lectures and talks in prestigious forums such as CII (Confederation of Indian Industry) & Indian Music Experience.

#artheals #artforall

We are happy to present Arushi Mudgal as the next dancer in the Art Heals series. She will be joining us live tomorrow (Wednesday, April 8th) at 6 p.m. IST.

Arushi Mudgal is one of the foremost young talents in the field of Odissi, known for her technical virtuosity and creative approach to tradition. She has trained under her aunt and Guru Vidushi Madhavi Mudgal at the Gandharva Mahavidyalaya, Delhi, a premiere music and dance institution founded by her grandfather, Pt Vinaya Chandra Maudgalya, and currently headed by her father, Pt Madhup Mudgal.

Arushi was selected as one of the Top Ten Dancers of 2018 by the New York Times. She tours extensively performing at various art festivals within the country and abroad. She has performed at some of the finest theatres of France like Theatre de la Ville, Musee Guimet, Cite de la Musique and Maison de la Danse, besides dancing at prestigious festivals in USA, UK, Austria, Germany, Spain, Belgium, Greece, China, Malaysia and Singapore. In India, she has been featured at the Music Academy, Krishna Gana Sabha, Karthik Fine Arts, Brahma Gana Sabha – Chennai, the Nishagandhi Festival – Trivandrum, N.C.P.A. – Mumbai, and Sangeet Natak Akademi’s Yuva Puraskar Festival – Delhi, among several others. She has also had the privilege of performing for dignitaries like the former Indian President Shri Abdul Kalam, President Shri Pranab Mukherjee, Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi and former President of USA, Mr Barack Obama at the Rashtrapati Bhavan, New Delhi.

In 2008, Arushi was the only Indian artiste to be invited by the famous dancer-choreographer Pina Bausch of Wuppertal Tanztheater to perform at the Internationales Tanz Festival in Dusseldorf, Germany.

Arushi has been featured as one of the young ‘Game Changers of India’ by India Today. For her contribution in the field of Odissi dance, she has been presented with various awards including Sangeet Natak Akademi’s prestigious national award - Ustad Bismillah Khan Yuva Puraskar, the Young Women Achievers’ Award by FICCI, the Indian President’s Bal Shree Award, the Rajiv Gandhi Excellence Award and several others.

#artheals #artforall

We are happy to present Shreya Devnath & Praveen Sparsh as the next set of musicians in the Art Heals series. They will be joining us live tomorrow (Wednesday, April 8th) at 12:30 p.m. IST.

Shreya Devnath

Shreya Devnath is a student of the legendary Sri Lalgudi Jayaraman. She is a well-established solo violinist, who also curates, performs and tours with “A Carnatic Quartet”, a Carnatic instrumental ensemble, as also “An Experiment with Sound and Music”, a duet with percussionist Praveen Sparsh. A capable vocalist, and committed teacher, Shreya handles students from different parts of the world. She has toured the US and UK extensively, as also Australia, Singapore, Malaysia, Indonesia, Sri Lanka and Dubai for concerts and workshops. She has scored and performed music for plays, ad jingles and short films. Shreya has also created music outreach programs for underprivileged children, with the intent of spreading the joy of music far, wide and deep. Her music is characterised by substance and freshness, a journey for the artiste and the audience.

Praveen Sparsh

Praveen Sparsh is one of the most sought after Mridangam exponents in the field of Carnatic music today. Having trained in the mridangam under Guruvayur Sri Dorai from the age of five, Praveen is now also a multi percussionist and a music producer who has scored and performed music for plays, ad jingles and short films. He has toured the United States extensively, as also, countries like Luxembourg, Germany, Belgium, France, Amsterdam, Singapore, Malaysia, Srilanka, Jakarta, Sydney, Melbourne, Israel and Palestine. Praveen’s perception of music is as nuanced as it is precise, and his boundless artistic curiosity reflects in his wide array of musical explorations.

We are happy to present Dr. Gayatri Kannan as the next dancer in the Art Heals series. She will be joining us live tomorrow (Tuesday, April 7th) at 6 p.m. IST.

Gayatri hails from an artistic family - her mother Smt. Uma Sriram is the senior most disciple of Dr. Padma Subrahmanyam.
Gayatri is one of the senior most disciples of Dr. Padma Subrahmanyam (Director, Nrithyodaya) for dance and Vidwan Sri S. Rajam for music. She is also the main singer for her Guru and her disciples.
With a Degree in Sanskrit, Gayatri obtained her Ph.D Degree  for “Madhura Vijayam - A Literary Study". A recepient of "Yuva Kala Bharati" and "Nrithya Choodamani" Gayatri is presently the Principal of Nrithyodaya. She is married to Dr. Padma Subrahmanyam's nephew Sri B. Kannan, a well known Veena Vidwan and Secretary of Nrithyodaya.

She is the strongest woman we know of, for she incessantly bears and nurtures us all. This time - a lockdown of sorts across the globe - seems to be a sort of vacation for her, right? 
Well, honestly, let her enjoy it! And while she is at it let us all take an oath to never let her down!

It is indeed an honour for Aalaap to be collaborating with the Earth Day Network on this lovely project that is beyond gender, caste, creed ,race and religion. This is just a story of the arts and artists coming together to say Thank You to the mother that bears and protects us all. 
On 22nd of this month, we celebrate Earth Day and until then we are going to be flooding you with really fun snippets from the making and creation of Dharti Ma, a tribute to Earth. This song is an amalgamation of styles rendered by some of the finest musicians from India - Bombay Jayashri, Kaushiki Chakraborty, Shankar Mahadevan, Hans Raj Hans, Mahesh Kale, Shweta Mohan, Abhay Jodhpurkar, Abhishek Raghuram and MD Pallavi.

Stay tuned and we promise you that this week is going to be a lot of fun!

We are sure you will all agree that expression/communication is the ultimate goal of mankind and the arts is the most creative avenue for that expression of life, in a sense.
 It has been exactly 24 hours since we presented Through his Lens, a marathon of abhinaya with 8 eminent male artistes and we are still reeling from that magic the artistes created on screen - we mean insta live :) Vaibhav Arekar set off our festival with an ode to lord shiva and segued into a very popular song on Lord Krishna but handled it in a reflective, introspective way. Krishna Nee Beganae Baaro, unlike the usual love of a mother that we are often used to seeing, came alive as a search for the warmth of a child’s innocence. Christopher (Gurusamy) lead the way thereon from conventional to contemporary in terms of thought and music. A bold Javali where the nayika (heroine) shuns away the judgements of society. We also loved how he travelled from the bold to the broken featuring a lovelorn Radha and came back to the modern world with a Javali that has lyrics written in both Telugu and English – truly one-of-its-kind. The contemporary in the classic was further enhanced by Praveen Kumar who identified a very traditional piece that captures the the relationship between Krishna and Yashodha and viewed it from an entirely male perspective. He went a step ahead and appropriated the choice of song to the slogan of the present – ‘Stay Home’! Kasi (Aysola) took us through a linguistic journey choosing a song in Telugu, Tamil and Hindi and establishing how the shades of abhinaya can change with the change of language. Shijith (Nambiar) set out the mood to be rather romantic and took us through a myriad of emotions where he questioned, loved and finally surrendered. Devotion and love are two sides of the same coin which finally lead to a divine surrender and this is what Bhavajan (Kumar) brought to us. The keertanam was a devotee’s celebration of the Lord’s magic from which he travelled down a path of love and pain through the Ashtapadi. Parshwanath (Upadhye) created a surreal aura through his music and dance which he performed simultaneously. Contd in comments

Because sometimes, we forget to say thank you that is befitting enough for the generosity with which artistes share and showcase their arts! We at Aalaap thoroughly enjoyed presenting this series which was a deep dive of sorts into specific ideas - ragams, language and poetry - by a bunch of women - all of whom we admire - and a young talent from Austin Texas, Vishaal Sapuram, who also came on board with the same spontaneity that these gorgeous women did when we sounded them off this idea. We enjoyed listening to Kaapi as much as we did the joyous Sankarabharanam; we hummed along and celebrated the aesthetic Reeti Gowlai and we had goosebumps when we heard Desh; we discovered the many facets of Mukhari and travelled along the landscape of language and finally signed off with the power of poetry that has a quality of strength, pathos, rawness, and an unwashed sense of vulnerability. We loved it and we thought we must say Thank You for the Music! Stay with us as we help you cope this lockdown and together, let’s distract ourselves and soak in the arts! @murali.amritha @vidhyaraghavan @sriranjaninsta @nisha.rajagopalan @bharathiramasubban @sushmasaurus #hopeinthetimeofcorona #music #gratitude

What is the art of expression? How does it manifest differently through different pairs of lenses? How does each artiste approach and treat a piece? And how does that articulation affect, elevate and impact our response? What goes into the process of perspective? 
In our attempt to find some answers and think deeply thereafter about the multiplicity of expressions and the individual approach with which they find expression, we’ve curated for you Through his Lens, a festival of abhinaya by some of the most amazing male artistes in the world of Bharatanatyam. It’s a marathon session curated for a marathon generation with distraction and a short attention span but it’s an earnest attempt to see how we can still make a difference in letting you access the arts a little better, a little deeper! 
Thank you to the artistes! We are truly humbled and we can’t wait to see the magic unfold! Tomorrow (Saturday) 5pm to 9pm. Instagram live! @praveenkumardance @vaibhavdance @parshwanathupadhye @pavitra_krishna_bhat @christophergurusamy @bhavajan.kumar @kasiaysola @shijith_n_parvathy @shijith_nambiar #hopeinthetimeofcorona #dance #abhinaya #expressions #articulations #marathon #bharatanatyam #spontaneous #gowiththeflow

We are really looking to soaking in Mukhari ragam tomorrow with the amazing musician Nisha Rajagopalan. We asked her why she picked this ragam and she spoke about how Mukhari is a beautiful rakti raga with elegant and graceful contours. Often Mukhari tends to be viewed as embodying the shoka rasa, which she feels is only one aspect of this grand raga. We can’t wait for tomorrow @nisha.rajagopalan #hopeinthetimeofcorona #music #ragam #immersion #classical #carnatic

Tania Chatterjee is a travel photographer, storyteller, and an educator. based in Kolkata. Tania has a strong acumen to portray indigenous cultural, inspiring human stories, social issues and travel stories across several states of India as well as different countries. She is the CEO and mentor of a photographic organization called FOTORBIT Pvt. Ltd. 
She is also working with UNDP as a consultant photographer; she has worked on various photographic assignments with renowned agencies like NatGeoTraveller India, VIVO India. etc, judged numerous photography contests and conduct various national and international photography workshops. Tania’s photos have been widely published and exhibited around the world, along with numerous awards.

join us in the live session with @taniachatterjee.official on the 12th of April 2020 at 7:00 PM.
